meanings.definition: Relating to the application of mechanical principles to biological systems.
meanings.sent1: The biomechanical analysis of how animals move helps scientists understand their bodies.
meanings.sent2: The biomechanical properties of a bone determine its strength and flexibility.
meanings.sent3: The biomechanical dance moves of the robot were both impressive and amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her biomechanical precision in playing the piano was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The biomechanical design of the new prosthetic leg made walking feel natural and effortless.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of the structure and function of living organisms using principles of mechanics.
meanings.sent1: Biomechanical research helps us understand how living creatures function.
meanings.sent2: The biomechanical engineer designed a device to mimic the movement of a human hand.
meanings.sent3: The biomechanical explanation for why cats always land on their feet is quite interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her biomechanical approach to gardening involved studying plant movements.
meanings.sent5: The biomechanical analysis of bird flight revealed fascinating aerodynamic principles.
